results.title: Rouge [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Jackie Chan and Stanley Kwan
results.brief_description: Fleur, a courtesan in her former life, returns as a ghost to Hong Kong in the 1980s. She had failed to meet her lover, Chan, in the afterlife following their double suicide fifty years earlier. It seems that Chan, then heir to a fortune, did not die and is now a failed opera actor and film extra. The film is a portrait of Fleur - ‘one more addition to the long line of abused women in Chinese cinema’ (Tony Rayns), who, nevertheless is not a passive victim. Kwan elegantly constructs, through flashbacks, mildly satirical parallel visions of Hong Kong in the thirties and eighties creating a sense of the transience of things including love. Cast includes Anita Mui, Leslie Cheung, Alex Man. Based on the novel by Lee Bik-Wah. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Rotorua radius
results.brief_description: Shows the varied sporting, scenic and thermal attractions found within a forty mile radius of the town of Rotorua, the centre of New Zealand’s thermal region.

results.title: Rotorua lookabout
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and Peter Hutt
results.brief_description: Presents, along with the tourist attractions and facilities of the Rotorua district of the North Island of New Zealand, a glimpse of the Maori traditions of the region, hot springs, geysers and the steam clouds which suggest the tremendous power of the thermal phenomena beneath the earth’s surface.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Ronald Bowie and Peter Hutt

results.title: Ross Gibson interview: tape #1
results.brief_description:
Interview Date: 21st March, 2002.
Ross Gibson takes the interviewers through the ACMI site discussing issues regarding the conception of the building, ideas and philosophies behind the interaction between the public and the space, working processes, anticipated audience experiences and, a general background of the history of the planning and construction of the Centre.

results.title: Ross Gibson interview Tape #2
results.brief_description:
Interview Date: 22nd March, 2002.
Ross Gibson discusses a number of issues relating to the curatorial background and philosophy of assembling the ACMI collection. Ross also discusses the approach taken by ACMI staff to generating content and assembling the collection with the viewer’s experience in mind. Other topics of discussion relate to the genesis of Ross’ involvement with the project, an overview of his work while Creative Director of ACMI, and a discussion of specific works in the permanent collection of exemplary works.

results.title: Ross Gibson and Clare Stewart Radio National interview
results.brief_description:
Ross Gibson explains how the environment and digital technology will be utilised at the Australian Centre for the Moving Image (ACMI) and in particular in the Screen Gallery. He and Clare Stewart briefly discuss budgeting issues and whether Cinematheque funding will be affected by the move towards digital delivery.
The interview is part of the Arts Show on Radio National.

results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, Norman Laird and Rodney Musch
results.brief_description: Historic Ross Bridge, in Tasmania, and the excellent craftsmanship of its stone figures by the enigmatic and gifted sculptor, Daniel Herbert.

results.title: Rosie's walk
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Morton Schindel and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: To the tune of “Turkey In The Straw”, the little red hen Rosie struts across the barnyard keeping her country cool, while unknowingly leading a stalking fox into one disaster after another. The spirited country music accompanying Pat Hutchins’ colourful illustrations make this suspenseful story a delightful fast-moving film.
